title: [QUESTION] SKMask.Create has uint rowBytes parameter?
body:
The signature of `SKMask.Create` is 

```cs
    public static unsafe SKMask Create(
      ReadOnlySpan<byte> image,
      SKRectI bounds,
      uint rowBytes,
      SKMaskFormat format)
```

So `rowBytes` is an `uint` here.

However, the `RowBytes` properties of the other classes return an `int`, e.g. `SKBitmap.RowBytes`

Is this by design?
